body_html:
We may want to shift some symbols to a private shared object (or the language bindings) so we don't conflict with symbols in extensions, but it doesn't sound like that's an issue here. If you want to use TensorFlow rather than adding ops/kernels, use the C++ or C API, not tf_cc_binary rules.

@skye is working on a distribution for the C++ API AFAIK. The C API has one.
body_text:
We may want to shift some symbols to a private shared object (or the language bindings) so we don't conflict with symbols in extensions, but it doesn't sound like that's an issue here. If you want to use TensorFlow rather than adding ops/kernels, use the C++ or C API, not tf_cc_binary rules.
@skye is working on a distribution for the C++ API AFAIK. The C API has one.
body:
We may want to shift some symbols to a private shared object (or the language bindings) so we don't conflict with symbols in extensions, but it doesn't sound like that's an issue here. If you want to use TensorFlow rather than adding ops/kernels, use the C++ or C API, not tf_cc_binary rules.

@skye is working on a distribution for the C++ API AFAIK. The C API [has one](https://www.tensorflow.org/install/install_c).
